results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of [n] for which the sum of the positions of the left-to-right maxima is k (1 <= k <= n(n+1)/2).
comment: Sum of entries in row n = n! = A000142(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..50, flattened
I. Kortchemski, Asymptotic behavior of permutation records, arXiv: 0804.0446 [math.CO], 2008-2009.
formula: Generating polynomial of row n is t(t^2+1)(t^3+2)...(t^n+n-1).
example: T(4,6)=3 because we have 1243, 1342 and 2341 with left-to-right maxima at positions 1,2,3.
maple: P:=proc(n) options operator, arrow: sort(expand(product(t^j+j-1,j=1..n))) end proc: for n to 7 do seq(coeff(P(n),t,i),i=1..(1/2)*n*(n+1)) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..degree(p)))(b(n)):
mathematica: row[n_] := CoefficientList[Product[t^k + k - 1, {k, 1, n}], t] // Rest;
